summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from June 2020 discussing the coordination of the FBI Victim Services Division's involvement with the newly announced Epstein Victims' Compensation Program. The emails focus on drafting and approving a statement and contact information for victims, with concerns about scrutiny and proper vetting through legal and public affairs channels.

persons.name: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: The primary correspondent managing the FBI Victim Services Division's response to the request for a statement and contact info for the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program materials.

persons.name: Trial Attorney
persons.context: An attorney based in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, who is the point of contact for the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, requesting the FBI Victim Services Division's contact information for victims.

connections.person1: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
connections.description: Communicating to coordinate the inclusion of FBI victim services contact information in the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program materials for victims.

events.title: Epstein Victims' Compensation Program Launch
events.description: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program is scheduled to begin, with materials being finalized for distribution to victims.
personsInvolved: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division

keyFacts: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was set to launch on June 25, 2020.
The FBI Victim Services Division was asked to provide contact information and a potential statement for inclusion in program materials to assist victims.
Internal FBI emails show high-level scrutiny and vetting requirements (through OGC, OPA, NY EM, CDC, and SDNY) for any public statement related to the Epstein case due to its sensitivity.
The communication highlights the ongoing investigative nature of the Epstein case as of June 2020.
